conclusion: Liquid will flow out from A, B, C, and D, and the task is to predict whether it flows into container E or F after passing through baffles.
The image shows four labeled points (A, B, C, D) at the top, arrows indicating flow direction, baffles in the middle, and two containers (E and F) at the bottom.
A flows downward and then to the left.
B flows downward and then to the right.
C flows downward and then curves to the left.
D flows downward and then curves to the right.
A's flow goes to the left.
B's flow goes to the right.
C's flow curves to the left.
D's flow curves to the right.
A and C both have flows that curve to the left and will flow into container E.
B and D both have flows that curve to the right and will flow into container F.
Final answer: A and C will flow into container E, and B and D will flow into container F.
